metadata.title: CVE-2017-11671 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - low.
metadata.description: Under certain circumstances, the ix86_expand_builtin function in i386.c in GNU Compiler Collection (GCC) version 4.6, 4.7, 4.8, 4.9, 5 before 5.5, and 6 before 6.4 will generate instruction sequences that clobber the status flag of the RDRAND and RDSEED intrinsics before it can be read, potentially causing failures of these instructions to go unreported. This could potentially lead to less randomness in random number generation.

criterions.comment: gcc-3.3 package in hirsute is affected and may need fixing.
gcc-7 package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7.3.0-16ubuntu3').
gcc-arm-none-eabi package in hirsute is affected and may need fixing.
gcc-avr package in hirsute is affected and may need fixing.
gcc-defaults package in hirsute is affected and may need fixing.
gcc-h8300-hms package in hirsute is affected and may need fixing.
gcc-m68hc1x package in hirsute is affected and may need fixing.
gcc-mingw-w64 package in hirsute is affected and may need fixing.
gcc-msp430 package in hirsute is affected and may need fixing.
gcc-snapshot package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:20180425-1ubuntu1').
